answers.answer: Hi Jennie and Welcome to the Pain Management Forum.  Sorry to hear about your breast pain. I know how much pain that can be and how frightening it can be.Please know that you are always welcome here but you may want to post this same question in our Woman 's Health Forum.If you have breast density do you have Fibro-Cystic Breasts? It's a condition usually seen in younger women but not always. Caffeine products can greatly aggravate the pain. Often by avoiding caffeine you can control the pain. I know this because I have the condition and have had it for many years. In the past the pain has become to extreme that I could not lay on the effected side/breast... or if I rolled onto it during the night it would wake me.Physician's tell me that once you reach menopause the symptoms of Fibro-cystic breasts should greatly decrease. I have found that this is not true in all cases.  Obviously I don't know if you have this condition but please bring it up to your physician for discussion. There is a lot of information on the internet.  You may want to search and see if your symptoms fit.I hope this has been helpful. Good luck to you and please let us know what you discover.Peace,~Tuck

question: I am a58yr. old woman with diabetes, high cholesterol, both parents with heart disease (father:died @ 63yr massive heart attack) (mother: pacemaker) and I am post menopausual and unable to take hormone replacement or cholesterol medications.Recently I have been expierencing left breast pain. my Dr.s' PA sent me for a mamogram which resulted in a finding of two non-cancerous appearring fiberomas and dense fiberous tissue.suggesting further testing. The pain remains. It is dull and I can feel it in my chest, shoulder, back and just under my left breast. the Dr. checked me for costalchondritis but did not feel it was that. then he said we may never know what it is from and left it at that . I still have the pain where do I go from here?
title: left sided breast/chest pain
